w:r.w:t: Define all words in your own handwriting on loose-leaf paper. Write the term (number them! 1, 2, 3…), then the definition, then the example. Some students like to do them “chart style” with columns for term, definition, and example. FOLLOW THESE RULES:
Due by the beginning of class on the Unit Test day.
. This is better for your memory.
required; I suggest blue/black pen for legibility.
. Organize them by topic and number them
just like how they are listed below
Write the term, the definition, and an example for each term
Examples can be things like a specific place/region where it happens on Earth or how it occurs in real life (e.g. a real current/historical event or a real problem/solution).
Pacing Idea: Do each set as we cover each topic (e.g. complete the 7.4 terms right after we cover 7.4 in class).
Study Idea: You could choose to write out the terms and definitions early in the unit, and add examples closer to the test date to help you review the terms.
7.7 Changes as a Result of the World Economy
